item.title: Companies Warn of Dire Disruptions From Coronavirus
item.description: The economic toll of the coronavirus pandemic mounted as companies warned of severe disruptions and collapsing demand tipped oil prices into negative territory.

item.title: Slow to Close Businesses, Italy's Economic Hub Can't Shake Off Coronavirus
item.description: Italy’s coronavirus pandemic passed its peak three weeks ago. But the ebbing of contagion is slow, prolonging the pain of the national lockdown, and the biggest problem is where it all began: Lombardy.

item.title: Singapore Had a Coveted Virus Plan. What Went Wrong?
item.description: Singapore had a plan to fight the coronavirus from the very start, with one of the world’s best contact-tracing operations. Now its infections are rising quickly.

item.title: China Bat Expert Says Wuhan Lab Wasn't Source of New Coronavirus
item.description: Virologist Shi Zhengli and her colleagues are battling suspicions that the coronavirus that causes Covid-19 escaped from her laboratories in Wuhan, where the outbreak was first identified.

item.title: The Critical Variable in Keeping Coronavirus in Check
item.description: Governments across Europe and in the U.S. say they have driven down a key coronavirus variable to levels that suggest lockdowns are containing the spread of the deadly virus.

item.title: Iran Begins Soft Reopening After Coronavirus Shutdowns
item.description: Iran’s government allowed local bazaars and shopping malls to reopen on Monday, a potential milestone for a country that was one of the first outside of China to be hit by the new coronavirus.
